title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening with HR, then an interview with a panel. The panel asked standard questions about my experience and interest in St. Thomas. The possibility of working with that team excited me. I ultimately declined the offer because I was so turned off by HR's refusal to negotiate salary. She made it sound like I was foolish for asking them to consider my relevant experience because it was not in higher ed. I was interested in the job to finish my degree and the position only required a high school education. Even so, I was scoffed at for trying to negotiate a living wage because I didn't have a degree and had never worked in higher ed. I don't know how St. Thomas can claim to embrace diversity when their HR department just insulted a POC for asking them to consider a different type of experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at St. Thomas?

title: Digital Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews via Zoom all asking about past experience, situational questions, and methodologies. I spoke with the director of the office, their colleague and two others on the team. I would say the interview is relatively easy.
Interview Questions: Where would you start the process for creating content?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Submit a resume and get hired. I did not have an actual interview, just got an email asking to meet to start training at the coffee shop. You do not need any experience for this job.
Interview Questions: N/A there was no interview

title: Student Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It is a one-on-one interview with the Hiring Manager. She asked questions based on my resume and after listening to my answers she explained the expectations for the role I applied for.
Interview Questions: How does your experience map to the role that you applied for?

title: Content Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Total of two interviews both with the same two people in senior leadership in the department. The first was a general overview of the role and my background and the second was a presentation of a "take home" UX Content assignment.  Both people were extremely kind and thoughtful.
Interview Questions: Explain how inclusivity and diversity is important to you in the workplace.

title: Conference Crew Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of one round in person where you would interview with two people and go over expected job duties and expectations of workers in their day to day activities
Interview Questions: Describe a time you overcame obstacles

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: I interview for the intern position and there were 2 rounds one with HR and team. It was a pretty good experience and everything was normal and on time. I was given enough information
Interview Questions: Tell me about your weakness

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews. One with HR, and a few managers. A third interview to meet the team. It was an open conversation, and a behavioral based interview. I felt it was a good process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was incredibly smooth, and enjoyable. The staff was present and invested in the process and I felt like they genuinely cared about me as a candidate. Overall they made it a much more enjoyable experience
Interview Questions: Why i wanted to work for them

title: English Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a telephonic interview. I was asked a list of questions to make sure that I will be the right fit for the position. After a series of questions when the interviewer thought that I was the right fit for the position, I was explained about my job duties and responsibilities, and the next steps of the interview process.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to be flexible for the job position?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Overall, the interview process was efficient, communication was clear, and my interactions with the recruiter and members of the hiring committee were positive.  

Unfortunately, after the 2nd interview, communication completely halted for nearly 3 weeks. I sent a follow-up email that wasn't responded to, and a few days later received a pretty boilerplate notification that I hadn't been selected.  

I truly enjoyed the interview process, and understand there may have been negotiations with the candidate they selected that delayed communication with me, but I just would have loved to have been kept in the loop a bit more after the 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to the mission of the university?

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Hiring committee was personable, approachable, and stood by their academic integrity.  I found the process to be efficient, their questions to be reasonable, and their practices in pedagogy to be progressive.
Interview Questions: Transference of experience into classroom teaching.  Comfortability in teaching certain subjects. Experience with diversity in the classroom.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Short, met office team, got a sense of the workplace. I applied online and was asked about my resume in person. Very easy and simple. I would know your resume front and back
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself

title: Staffer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with the Center director and answered a few questions about my hobbies, interests, why I want to work at the Center, my visions for the future of the Center and myself, etc.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Peace Studies/Criminal Justice Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Last minute interview invitation, received on a Friday for the following week. Those conducting the interview did not seem interested in my responses, and everyone seemed overwhelmed and unexcited about the process. Also, they never followed up with me. They didn't even have the respect or organization to send out an email saying "hey I think we're going in a different direction, thanks for applying." Overall, the experience left a sour taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: How will you contribute to the mission of the school? Why did you choose to apply to this school?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Had an phone screen interview with the recruiter and hiring manager - was hard to hear at times. There were a few curve ball questions I wasn't prepared for, but fit the job - just more in depth than you usually experience in phone screens (i.e. situational) My biggest complaint was I did not find out if I was selected for the next round or not for almost three weeks.
Interview Questions: Situational about marketing and social media - how would I set up this situation?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't that bad. Basic things like where you've worked before and why you want to work there. The pay isn't great but it's work study so you can't complain
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Service Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: 5 people, list of questions, poorly thought out.  HR may know the basic rules, but clearly no idea what it takes for the hire to do the job.  The questions they asked to get to the in person interview were weak.  the entire HR dept is all women whom hate men.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where something broke

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Was called in to talk about the job. Asked about past experience and what I would do in certain situations. Talked to two different people, which is important to know. Overall was an enjoyable experience.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you do not know the answer to something?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an efficient processing speed, within one week they decide to interview me. For another week, they set up a meeting for the final decision and gave the offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Commuter Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
-There was an online application that was sent out to the student body beforehand 
-As a follow up, there was an interview day where applicants went to the hiring grad student to interview
Interview Questions:
-They asked about past experiences
-The asked about passions

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. The interview was easy and straight forward. I met with a panel of individuals from the office and they asked standard interview questions. Got an offer a week later.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: An application, resume, and cover letter were required. One round of in-person interviews with multiple people. The final decision was made in around a month. It was an average and smooth process.
Interview Questions: How will you manage your school workload and working hours?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, then interviewed by a committee on campus, and given an offer one week later. Be prepared to connect your experience to the mission of the university, regardless of the job for which you apply. Also, be prepared to talk about diversity and your vision for remaining longterm.
Interview Questions: How does your job relate to the mission (of UST and of the center)?

title: Graduate Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Four people took my interview. All of them asked different questions. About mynpast experience and how i like to get orders. What is my work preferences. It was intense more than a student position expectation i think.
Interview Questions: How will you handle conflict

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening followed by a committee-style interview with both peers and bosses. Asked about $$ during the initial phone screening. HR will discourage you from negotiating salary offer even if departments have the budget to pay more.  You might have to turn down an offer in order to get a higher salary. If you are BIPOC or LGBTQ+ or bring diversity to your field, don't accept a salary less than your ideal amount because you will be asked to do significant DEI work on top of your normal duties since that is an institutional priority.
Interview Questions: How does your role advance the mission of the university?

title: Instructor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions:
1. Online application with the usual teaching philosophy, CV,  as well as specific questions. 

2. Phone interview where I responded to a series of questions that were provided to me a couple of days before the interview.  The interviewers did not respond to my answers or ask follow up questions which threw me off a bit. This was meant to provide a consistent interview process. 
 
3. Two-day interview and campus visit. Four days before my interview I was given a detailed description of issues that each of my two talks needed to address. I was also given several papers on education and the Catholic Intellectual tradition that I would then be asked about. 

I gave a teaching lecture of my choice and a talk on promoting academic excellence.  Talks were followed by about 40 minutes of questions. There were also five one-one-one interviews that were fairly informal. 

Everyone that I met during my two days at Saint Thomas was friendly, welcoming, and answered my questions about the University and the job. Committee members were prepared and had specific questions that demonstrated that they read my application.
Interview Questions: Pat answers will not cut it. Be prepared to provide thoughtful answers and to demonstrate that you understand the Catholic intellectual tradition. I was asked many questions about my teaching philosophy and my experience and ability to teach a multicultural student body. I never felt like there were any religious test or that I would be expected to promote any ideology.

title: Digital Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was selected for a contract position based on a single interview. Re-interviewed in front of a panel for the same position at the end of the contract and was re-hired in that role.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Met with a couple of people in the department who went through my resume and vetted out my skills.It was a group panel that asked me questions about my interests and my job availability during the week.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and how this can help you grow here.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: This post checks for more experience than the actual interview. In fact in some cases they will consider you, if you finish few mandatory courses they are going to provide the offer.
Interview Questions: How good are you with python and how much do you give yourself on range of 0 to 10

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: To interview for this position you meet with the Tech Desk supervisor and possibly another higher-up. They ask about your technical knowledge and how you would react to different situations. They want to ensure that you are able to effectively communicate with clients and that you are willing to learn.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience helping clients?

title: Tenure Track Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview for this type of job - 2 days of interviewing including a presentation and dinner with faculty.  Interview one on one with department chair and in small groups of faculty.  One of the most interesting and informative parts was a discussion of the school's mission with other faculty.  Lots of changes to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What courses would you be able to teach?

title: MBA Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The communication was really well maintained, multiple meetings, very supportive and informative
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were expected, very friendly environment

title: Athletic Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy and brief, very informal. They have a decently high turnover rate of employees since students graduate or get other jobs. The people that work care, so they aren't trying to stump or trick you on any questions - they just really do want to know more about you and why you believe you should be an employee. The overall process was super quick and easy, as well as having a fast turn around time.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the organization?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: You will have to interview with technical manager and other technical staff individually. They will ask your current skill sets and fill out a form to confirm your knowledge background.
Interview Questions: Software or trouble shooting scenario related to the skills or knowledge background you claimed might be asked. Get prepared.

title: Outreach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of St. Thomas · Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: This was an internal promotion so I was encouraged to apply by colleagues and university leadership. I felt well supported by my team and was humbled and pleased by the recognition given by the university. I did two interviews, one with the dean and one with the panel. I was given a clear picture of the duties and responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Why should we offer you the position?
